alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 31 at 5:39PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 900 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over parts of north and east Kauai. Rain was falling at a rate of up to 2 inches per hour. Although showers have briefly tapered off, additional showers capable of producing periods of heavy rain will be moving through this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lihue, Kapaa, Princeville, Kilauea, North Fork Wailua Trails, Wailua Homesteads, Hanalei, Wailua, Moloaa, Wainiha, Anahola, Haena, Na Pali State Park, Kokee State Park, Kalihiwai, Wailua River State Park, Kealia, Hanamaulu and Puhi. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 900 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
